intro: Hebonga siamensis, commonly known as the Siam hebonga, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, opposite leaves. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, with four petals and prominent stamens. Hebonga siamensis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and shrublands.
